data.name: Texas hold'em winning hand
data.description:
While dividing the online poker pot, we need to determine which player or players have the winning hand.

## Community and hole cards

In each game of poker, five **community cards** are dealt. These cards are shared among all players. Additionally, each player gets two private **hole cards**. A poker hand consists of exactly five cards. Since each player has seven cards available, they must choose which five cards to use to form their best hand.

## Poker hand categories
[Poker hands](https://www.unibet.co.uk/polopoly_fs/1.696321.1636533552!/image/1470891313.jpg)

A hand is scored based on its category. There are nine categories ranging from **High Card** to **Straight Flush** (**Royal Flush** is not a category; it's the best variant of a **Straight Flush**).

## Determining the winner

When multiple players fall into the same category, look at who has the highest card. The value of a card is based on its rank. Two is the lowest and ace the highest (low aces are valid).

If multiple players have a card with the same value, look at the second highest card, and so forth.

In rare cases, the best five cards for multiple players have the exact same values, resulting in a tie (split win).

## Card representation

A card is represented by two characters:
- First character is the rank: 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, t(en), j(ack), q(ueen), k(ing), a(ce)
- Second character is the suit: c(lubs), d(iamonds), h(earts), s(pades)

Examples:

`2c` two of clubs

`td` ten of diamonds

`qh` queen of hearts

`as` ace of spades

## Player representation
A player is represented as a string with their 2 hole cards seperated by a space. Example: `'2c td'`

Players will be provided as an array of strings. Example of 3 players: `['4s 9s', 'ad jh', '2c ts']`

## Expectation

Return an array with the indexes of the players holding the best hand.
